Types.Name: AddTaskResult
Types.Comment: Result for a single task added as part of a collection of tasks.

Key.Name: Status
Key.SummaryComment: The status of the add task request.

Key.Name: TaskId
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the task which this result applies to.

Key.Name: ETag
Key.SummaryComment: An ETag associated with a successfully added task.

Key.Name: LastModified
Key.SummaryComment: The last modified time associated with a successfully added task.

Key.Name: Location
Key.SummaryComment: The URL of a successfully added task.

Key.Name: Error
Key.SummaryComment: The error caught while attempting to add the task.

Types.Name: AffinityInformation
Types.Comment: A locality hint that can be used by the Batch service to select a compute node on which to start a new task.

Key.Name: AffinityId
Key.SummaryComment: An opaque string that represents a previously run task or compute node.

Types.Name: ApplicationPackageReference
Types.Comment: A reference to an application package to be deployed to compute nodes.

Key.Name: ApplicationId
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the application to be deployed on compute nodes.

Key.Name: Version
Key.SummaryComment: The version of the application to be deployed on compute nodes.
Key.RemarksComment: If not specified, the default version of the application, as defined in the application settings, is deployed. If no default version is defined in the application settings, you must specify a version in the <see cref="ApplicationPackageReference"/>.

Types.Name: ApplicationSummary
Types.Comment: Contains information about an application in an Azure Batch account.

Key.Name: DisplayName
Key.SummaryComment: The display name of the application.

Key.Name: Id
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the application.

Key.Name: Versions
Key.SummaryComment: A readonly list of available versions of the application.

Types.Name: AutoPoolSpecification
Types.Comment: Specifies characteristics for a temporary 'auto pool'. The Batch service will create this auto pool, run all the tasks for the job on it, and by default delete the pool once the job has completed.

Key.Name: AutoPoolIdPrefix
Key.SummaryComment: A prefix to be added to the unique identifier when a pool is automatically created.
Key.RemarksComment: The prefix is optional. If present, it can be up to 20 characters long and must adhere to the usual rules for ids (alphanumeric characters, hyphens and underscores only).

Key.Name: KeepAlive
Key.SummaryComment: Whether to keep the auto pool alive after its <see cref="PoolLifetimeOption"/> expires.
Key.RemarksComment: The default value is false.

Key.Name: PoolSpecification
Key.SummaryComment: The pool specification for the auto pool.

Key.Name: PoolLifetimeOption
Key.SummaryComment: The minimum lifetime of created auto pools, and how multiple jobs on a schedule are assigned to pools.
Key.RemarksComment: An auto pool may live longer than its PoolLifetimeOption if <see cref="KeepAlive"/> is set.

Types.Name: AutoScaleRunError
Types.Comment: An error that occurred when executing or evaluating a pool autoscale formula.

Key.Name: Code
Key.SummaryComment: A code for the autoscale error. See <see cref="Common.BatchErrorCodeStrings"/> for possible values.

Key.Name: Message
Key.SummaryComment: A message describing the autoscale error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

Key.Name: Values
Key.SummaryComment: A list of additional error details related to the autoscale error.

Types.Name: AutoScaleRun
Types.Comment: The results and errors from an evaluation or execution of a pool autoscale formula.

Key.Name: Timestamp
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the autoscale formula was last evaluated.

Key.Name: Results
Key.SummaryComment: The final values of all variables used in the evaluation of the autoscale formula. Each variable value is returned in the form $variable=value, and variables are separated by semicolons.

Key.Name: Error
Key.SummaryComment: Details of the error encountered evaluating the autoscale formula on the pool, if the evaluation was unsuccessful.

Types.Name: BatchError
Types.Comment: An error received from the Azure Batch service.

Key.Name: Code
Key.SummaryComment: A code for the error. See <see cref="Common.BatchErrorCodeStrings"/> for possible values.

Key.Name: Message
Key.SummaryComment: A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

Key.Name: Values
Key.SummaryComment: A collection of key-value pairs containing additional details about the error.

Types.Name: BatchErrorDetail
Types.Comment: An item of additional information included in a <see cref="BatchError"/>.

Key.Name: Key
Key.SummaryComment: An identifier specifying the meaning of the <see cref="Value"/> property.

Key.Name: Value
Key.SummaryComment: The additional information included with the <see cref="BatchError"/>.

Types.Name: Certificate
Types.Comment: A certificate that can be installed on compute nodes and can be used to authenticate operations on a node.

Key.Name: Data
Key.SummaryComment: The base64-encoded raw certificate data (contents of the .pfx or .cer file or data from which the <see cref="Certificate"/> was created).
Key.RemarksComment: <para>This property is set when creating a new <see cref="Certificate"/>. It is not defined for certificates retrieved from the Batch service.</para> <para>The maximum size is 10 KB.</para>

Key.Name: Thumbprint
Key.SummaryComment: The thumbprint of the certificate. This is a sequence of up to 40 hex digits.

Key.Name: ThumbprintAlgorithm
Key.SummaryComment: The algorithm used to derive the thumbprint.

Key.Name: Url
Key.SummaryComment: The URL of the certificate.

Key.Name: State
Key.SummaryComment: The current state of the certificate.

Key.Name: StateTransitionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the certificate entered its current state.

Key.Name: PreviousState
Key.SummaryComment: The previous state of the certificate.
Key.RemarksComment: If the certificate is in its initial <see cref="Common.CertificateState.Active"/> state, the PreviousState property is not defined.

Key.Name: PreviousStateTransitionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the certificate entered its previous state.
Key.RemarksComment: If the certificate is in its initial <see cref="Common.CertificateState.Active"/> state, the PreviousStateTransitionTime property is not defined.

Key.Name: CertificateFormat
Key.SummaryComment: The format of the certificate data.

Key.Name: Password
Key.SummaryComment: The password to access the certificate private key.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is set when creating a new <see cref="Certificate"/> from .pfx format data (see <see cref="CertificateOperations.CreateCertificate(byte[], string)"/> and <see cref="CertificateOperations.CreateCertificate(string, string)"/>). It is not defined for certificates retrieved from the Batch service.

Key.Name: PublicData
Key.SummaryComment: The public part of the certificate as a string containing base-64 encoded .cer format data.

Key.Name: DeleteCertificateError
Key.SummaryComment: The error that occurred on the last attempt to delete this certificate.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is null unless the certificate is in the <see cref="Common.CertificateState.DeleteFailed"/> state.

Types.Name: CertificateReference
Types.Comment: Represents a certificate object of the Azure Batch service.

Key.Name: StoreLocation
Key.SummaryComment: The <see cref="Common.CertStoreLocation"/> for the certificate.

Key.Name: StoreName
Key.SummaryComment: The name of the name of the certificate store. Besides <see cref="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.StoreName"/> the value can have a custom store name.

Key.Name: Thumbprint
Key.SummaryComment: The certificate thumbprint property of the certificate.

Key.Name: ThumbprintAlgorithm
Key.SummaryComment: The certificate thumbprint algorithm. Currently sha1 is the only supported algorithm.

Key.Name: Visibility
Key.SummaryComment: The set of users that can get to the private data of the installed certificate.

Types.Name: CloudJob
Types.Comment: An Azure Batch job.

Key.Name: CommonEnvironmentSettings
Key.SummaryComment: A list of common environment variable settings. These environment variables are set for all tasks in this <see cref="CloudJob"/> (including the Job Manager, Job Preparation and Job Release tasks).

Key.Name: CreationTime
Key.SummaryComment: The creation time of the job.

Key.Name: DisplayName
Key.SummaryComment: The display name of the job.

Key.Name: ETag
Key.SummaryComment: The ETag for the job.

Key.Name: ExecutionInformation
Key.SummaryComment: The execution information for the job.

Key.Name: Id
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the job.

Key.Name: Constraints
Key.SummaryComment: The execution constraints for the job.

Key.Name: JobManagerTask
Key.SummaryComment: The Job Manager task. The Job Manager task is launched when the <see cref="CloudJob"/> is started.

Key.Name: JobPreparationTask
Key.SummaryComment: The Job Preparation task. The Batch service will run the Job Preparation task on a compute node before starting any tasks of that job on that compute node.

Key.Name: JobReleaseTask
Key.SummaryComment: The Job Release task. The Batch service runs the Job Release task when the job ends, on each compute node where any task of the job has run.

Key.Name: LastModified
Key.SummaryComment: The last modified time of the job.

Key.Name: Metadata
Key.SummaryComment: A list of name-value pairs associated with the job as metadata.

Key.Name: PoolInformation
Key.SummaryComment: The pool on which the Batch service runs the job's tasks.

Key.Name: PreviousState
Key.SummaryComment: The previous state of the job.
Key.RemarksComment: If the job is in its initial <see cref="Common.JobState.Active"/> state, the PreviousState property is not defined.

Key.Name: OnAllTasksComplete
Key.SummaryComment: The action the Batch service should take when all tasks in the job are in the <see cref="Common.JobState.Completed"/> state.

Key.Name: OnTaskFailure
Key.SummaryComment: The action the Batch service should take when any task in the job fails.
Key.remarkComment: A task is considered to have failed if it completes with a non-zero exit code and has exhausted its retry count, or if it had a scheduling error.

Key.Name: PreviousStateTransitionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the job entered its previous state.
Key.RemarksComment: If the job is in its initial <see cref="Common.JobState.Active"/> state, the PreviousStateTransitionTime property is not defined.

Key.Name: Priority
Key.SummaryComment: The priority of the job. Priority values can range from -1000 to 1000, with -1000 being the lowest priority and 1000 being the highest priority.
Key.RemarksComment: The default value is 0.

Key.Name: State
Key.SummaryComment: The current state of the job.

Key.Name: StateTransitionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the job entered its current state.

Key.Name: Statistics
Key.SummaryComment: Resource usage statistics for the entire lifetime of the job.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is populated only if the <see cref="CloudJob"/> was retrieved with an <see cref="ODATADetailLevel.ExpandClause"/> including the 'stats' attribute; otherwise it is null.

Key.Name: Url
Key.SummaryComment: The URL of the job.

Key.Name: UsesTaskDependencies
Key.SummaryComment: Whether tasks in the job can define dependencies on each other.
Key.RemarksComment: The default value is false.

Types.Name: CloudJobSchedule
Types.Comment: A job schedule that allows recurring jobs by specifying when to run jobs and a specification used to create each job.

Key.Name: CreationTime
Key.SummaryComment: The creation time of the job schedule.

Key.Name: DisplayName
Key.SummaryComment: The display name of the job schedule.

Key.Name: ETag
Key.SummaryComment: The ETag of the job schedule.

Key.Name: ExecutionInformation
Key.SummaryComment: The execution information for the job schedule.

Key.Name: Id
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the job schedule.

Key.Name: JobSpecification
Key.SummaryComment: A <see cref="JobSpecification" /> containing details of the jobs to be created according to the <see cref="Schedule"/>.

Key.Name: LastModified
Key.SummaryComment: The last modified time of the job schedule.

Key.Name: Metadata
Key.SummaryComment: A list of name-value pairs associated with the schedule as metadata.

Key.Name: PreviousState
Key.SummaryComment: The previous state of the job schedule.
Key.RemarksComment: If the schedule is in its initial <see cref="Common.JobScheduleState.Active"/> state, the PreviousState property is not defined.

Key.Name: PreviousStateTransitionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the job schedule entered its previous state.
Key.RemarksComment: If the schedule is in its initial <see cref="Common.JobScheduleState.Active"/> state, the PreviousStateTransitionTime property is not defined.

Key.Name: Schedule
Key.SummaryComment: The schedule that determines when jobs will be created.

Key.Name: State
Key.SummaryComment: The current state of the job schedule.

Key.Name: StateTransitionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the <see cref="CloudJobSchedule"/> entered its current state.

Key.Name: Statistics
Key.SummaryComment: A <see cref="JobScheduleStatistics" /> containing resource usage statistics for the entire lifetime of the job schedule.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is populated only if the <see cref="CloudJobSchedule"/> was retrieved with an <see cref="ODATADetailLevel.ExpandClause"/> including the 'stats' attribute; otherwise it is null.

Key.Name: Url
Key.SummaryComment: The URL of the job schedule.

Types.Name: CloudPool
Types.Comment: A pool in the Azure Batch service.

Key.Name: AllocationState
Key.SummaryComment: An <see cref="Common.AllocationState"/> which indicates what node allocation activity is occurring on the pool.

Key.Name: AllocationStateTransitionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the pool entered its current <see cref="AllocationState"/>.

Key.Name: ApplicationPackageReferences
Key.SummaryComment: A list of application packages to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

Key.Name: AutoScaleEnabled
Key.SummaryComment: Whether the pool size should automatically adjust according to the <see cref="AutoScaleFormula"/>.
Key.RemarksComment: <para>If false, the <see cref="TargetDedicated"/> property is required, and <see cref="AutoScaleFormula"/> must be null.</para> <para>If true, the <see cref="AutoScaleFormula"/> property is required, and <see cref="TargetDedicated"/> must be null. The pool automatically resizes according to the formula.</para><para>The default value is false.</para>

Key.Name: AutoScaleEvaluationInterval
Key.SummaryComment: A time interval at which to automatically adjust the pool size according to the <see cref="AutoScaleFormula"/>.
Key.RemarksComment: The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum allowed value is 5 minutes.

Key.Name: AutoScaleFormula
Key.SummaryComment: A formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: <para>For how to write autoscale formulas, see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/batch-automatic-scaling/. This property is required if <see cref="AutoScaleEnabled"/> is set to true. It must be null if AutoScaleEnabled is false.</para><para>The formula is checked for validity before the pool is created. If the formula is not valid, an exception is thrown when you try to commit the <see cref="CloudPool"/>.</para>

Key.Name: AutoScaleRun
Key.SummaryComment: The results and errors from the last execution of the <see cref="AutoScaleFormula"/>.

Key.Name: CertificateReferences
Key.SummaryComment: A list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

Key.Name: CloudServiceConfiguration
Key.SummaryComment: The <see cref="CloudServiceConfiguration"/> for the pool.

Key.Name: CreationTime
Key.SummaryComment: The creation time for the pool.

Key.Name: CurrentDedicated
Key.SummaryComment: The number of compute nodes currently in the pool.

Key.Name: DisplayName
Key.SummaryComment: The display name of the pool.

Key.Name: ETag
Key.SummaryComment: The ETag for the pool.

Key.Name: Id
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the pool.

Key.Name: InterComputeNodeCommunicationEnabled
Key.SummaryComment: Whether the pool permits direct communication between its compute nodes.
Key.RemarksComment: Enabling inter-node communication limits the maximum size of the pool due to deployment restrictions on the nodes of the pool. This may result in the pool not reaching its desired size.

Key.Name: NetworkConfiguration
Key.SummaryComment: The network configuration of the pool.

Key.Name: LastModified
Key.SummaryComment: The last modified time of the pool.

Key.Name: MaxTasksPerComputeNode
Key.SummaryComment: The maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: The default value is 1. The maximum value of this setting depends on the size of the compute nodes in the pool (the <see cref="VirtualMachineSize"/> property).

Key.Name: Metadata
Key.SummaryComment: A list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.

Key.Name: ResizeError
Key.SummaryComment: The resize error encountered while performing the last resize on the <see cref="CloudPool"/>. This error is returned only when the Batch service encountered an error while resizing the pool, and when the pool's <see cref="CloudPool.AllocationState"/> is <see cref="AllocationState">Steady</see>.

Key.Name: ResizeTimeout
Key.SummaryComment: The timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool.

Key.Name: TaskSchedulingPolicy
Key.SummaryComment: How tasks are distributed among compute nodes in the pool.

Key.Name: StartTask
Key.SummaryComment: A task to run on each compute node as it joins the pool. The task runs when the node is added to the pool or when the node is restarted.

Key.Name: State
Key.SummaryComment: The current state of the pool.

Key.Name: StateTransitionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the pool entered its current state.

Key.Name: Statistics
Key.SummaryComment: The resource usage statistics for the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is populated only if the <see cref="CloudPool"/> was retrieved with an <see cref="ODATADetailLevel.ExpandClause"/> including the 'stats' attribute; otherwise it is null.

Key.Name: TargetDedicated
Key.SummaryComment: The desired number of compute nodes in the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: This property must be null if <see cref="AutoScaleEnabled"/> is set to true. It is required if AutoScaleEnabled is set to false.

Key.Name: Url
Key.SummaryComment: The URL of the pool.

Key.Name: VirtualMachineConfiguration
Key.SummaryComment: The <see cref="VirtualMachineConfiguration"/> of the pool.

Key.Name: VirtualMachineSize
Key.SummaryComment: The size of the virtual machines in the pool.  All virtual machines in a pool are the same size.
Key.RemarksComment: <para>For information about available sizes of virtual machines for Cloud Services pools (pools created with a <see cref="CloudServiceConfiguration"/>), see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/cloud-services-sizes-specs/. Batch supports all Cloud Services VM sizes except ExtraSmall.</para><para>For information about available VM sizes for pools using images from the Virtual Machines Marketplace (pools created with a <see cref="VirtualMachineConfiguration"/>) see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-linux-sizes/ or https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-windows-sizes/. Batch supports all Azure VM sizes except STANDARD_A0 and those with premium storage (for example STANDARD_GS, STANDARD_DS, and STANDARD_DSV2 series).</para>

Types.Name: CloudTask
Types.Comment: An Azure Batch task. A task is a piece of work that is associated with a job and runs on a compute node.

Key.Name: AffinityInformation
Key.SummaryComment: A locality hint that can be used by the Batch service to select a node on which to start the task.

Key.Name: CommandLine
Key.SummaryComment: The command line of the task.
Key.RemarksComment: The command line does not run under a shell, and therefore cannot take advantage of shell features such as environment variable expansion. If you want to take advantage of such features, you should invoke the shell in the command line, for example using "cmd /c MyCommand" in Windows or "/bin/sh -c MyCommand" in Linux.

Key.Name: ComputeNodeInformation
Key.SummaryComment: Information about the compute node on which the task ran.

Key.Name: MultiInstanceSettings
Key.SummaryComment: Information about how to run the multi-instance task.

Key.Name: CreationTime
Key.SummaryComment: The creation time of the task.

Key.Name: DependsOn
Key.SummaryComment: Any other tasks that this <see cref="CloudTask"/> depends on. The task will not be scheduled until all depended-on tasks have completed successfully.
Key.RemarksComment: The job must set <see cref="CloudJob.UsesTaskDependencies"/> to true in order to use task dependencies. If UsesTaskDependencies is false (the default), adding a task with dependencies will fail with an error.

Key.Name: DisplayName
Key.SummaryComment: The display name of the task.

Key.Name: ExitConditions
Key.SummaryComment: How the Batch service should respond when the task completes.

Key.Name: EnvironmentSettings
Key.SummaryComment: A list of environment variable settings for the task.

Key.Name: ETag
Key.SummaryComment: The ETag for the task.

Key.Name: FilesToStage
Key.SummaryComment: A list of files to be staged for the task.

Key.Name: ExecutionInformation
Key.SummaryComment: The execution information for the task.

Key.Name: Id
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the task.

Key.Name: LastModified
Key.SummaryComment: The last modified time of the task.

Key.Name: PreviousState
Key.SummaryComment: The previous state of the task.
Key.RemarksComment: If the task is in its initial <see cref="Common.TaskState.Active"/> state, the PreviousState property is not defined.

Key.Name: PreviousStateTransitionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the task entered its previous state.
Key.RemarksComment: If the task is in its initial <see cref="Common.TaskState.Active"/> state, the PreviousStateTransitionTime property is not defined.

Key.Name: ResourceFiles
Key.SummaryComment: A list of files that the Batch service will download to the compute node before running the command line.

Key.Name: RunElevated
Key.SummaryComment: Whether to run the task in elevated mode.

Key.Name: State
Key.SummaryComment: The current state of the task.

Key.Name: StateTransitionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the task entered its current state.

Key.Name: Statistics
Key.SummaryComment: Resource usage statistics for the task.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is populated only if the <see cref="CloudTask"/> was retrieved with an <see cref="ODATADetailLevel.ExpandClause"/> including the 'stats' attribute; otherwise it is null.

Key.Name: Constraints
Key.SummaryComment: The execution constraints that apply to this task.

Key.Name: Url
Key.SummaryComment: The URL of the task.

Key.Name: ApplicationPackageReferences
Key.SummaryComment: A list of application packages that the Batch service will deploy to the compute node before running the command line.

Types.Name: CloudServiceConfiguration
Types.Comment: The configuration for compute nodes in a pool based on the Azure Cloud Services platform.

Key.Name: OSFamily
Key.SummaryComment: The Azure Guest OS family to be installed on the virtual machines in the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: For more information about Guest OS families, see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix/.

Key.Name: TargetOSVersion
Key.SummaryComment: The Azure Guest OS version to be installed on the virtual machines in the pool. If no value is provided, the Batch service will default to "'*", which specifies the latest operating system version for the <see cref="OSFamily"/>.

Key.Name: CurrentOSVersion
Key.SummaryComment: The Azure Guest OS version currently installed on the virtual machines in the pool. This may differ from <see cref="TargetOSVersion"/> if the pool state is <see cref="Common.PoolState.Upgrading"/>.

Types.Name: ComputeNode
Types.Comment: Summarizes the state of a compute node.

Key.Name: Id
Key.SummaryComment: The id of compute node.

Key.Name: Url
Key.SummaryComment: The URL of compute node.

Key.Name: SchedulingState
Key.SummaryComment: Whether the node is available for task scheduling.

Key.Name: State
Key.SummaryComment: The current state of the compute node.

Key.Name: StateTransitionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the compute node entered the current state.

Key.Name: LastBootTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the compute node was started.

Key.Name: AllocationTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which this compute node was allocated to the pool.

Key.Name: IPAddress
Key.SummaryComment: The IP address associated with the compute node.

Key.Name: AffinityId
Key.SummaryComment: An opaque string that contains information about the location of the compute node.

Key.Name: VirtualMachineSize
Key.SummaryComment: The size of the virtual machine hosting the compute node.

Key.Name: TotalTasksRun
Key.SummaryComment: The number of tasks that have been run on this compute node from the time it was allocated to this pool. This includes Job Preparation, Job Release, and Job Manager tasks, but not the pool start task.

Key.Name: TotalTasksSucceeded
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of tasks which completed successfully (with exitCode 0) on the compute node. This includes Job Preparation, Job Release, and Job Manager tasks, but not the pool start task.

Key.Name: RunningTasksCount
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of currently running tasks on the compute node. This includes Job Preparation, Job Release, and Job Manager tasks, but not the pool start task.

Key.Name: StartTaskInformation
Key.SummaryComment: The detailed runtime information of the start task, including current state, error details, exit code, start time, end time, etc.

Key.Name: RecentTasks
Key.SummaryComment: The execution information for the most recent tasks that ran on this compute node. Note that this element is only returned if at least one task was run on this compute node since the time it was assigned to its current pool.

Key.Name: StartTask
Key.SummaryComment: The start task associated with all compute nodes in this pool.

Key.Name: CertificateReferences
Key.SummaryComment: the list of certificates installed on this compute node.

Key.Name: Errors
Key.SummaryComment: The list of errors that are currently being encountered by the compute node.

Types.Name: ComputeNodeError
Types.Comment: An error encountered by an Azure Batch compute node.

Key.Name: Code
Key.SummaryComment: A code for the compute node error. See <see cref="Common.BatchErrorCodeStrings"/> for possible values.

Key.Name: Message
Key.SummaryComment: A message describing the compute node error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

Key.Name: ErrorDetails
Key.SummaryComment: A list of additional error details related to the compute node error.

Types.Name: ComputeNodeInformation
Types.Comment: The compute node information class.

Key.Name: AffinityId
Key.SummaryComment: An opaque string that contains information about the location of the compute node.

Key.Name: ComputeNodeId
Key.SummaryComment: The compute node id.

Key.Name: ComputeNodeUrl
Key.SummaryComment: The URL of the compute node.

Key.Name: PoolId
Key.SummaryComment: The pool id.

Key.Name: TaskRootDirectory
Key.SummaryComment: The root directory of the current task on the compute node. You can use this path to retrieve files created by the task such as log files.

Key.Name: TaskRootDirectoryUrl
Key.SummaryComment: The URL to the root directory of the current task on the compute node.

Types.Name: ComputeNodeUser
Types.Comment: A user for a specific Azure Batch compute node.

Key.Name: Name
Key.SummaryComment: The name. If AddUser is specified for the commit operation, the value of this property is the name of the local Windows account created. If UpdateUser is specified for the commit operation, the value of this property selects the local Windows account to modify. Changing this property does not rename the local Windows account on the compute node.

Key.Name: IsAdmin
Key.SummaryComment: The administrative privilege level of the user account. The value of this property is ignored when UpdateUser is specified for the commit operation.

Key.Name: ExpiryTime
Key.SummaryComment: The expiry time.

Key.Name: Password
Key.SummaryComment: The password.

Key.Name: SshPublicKey
Key.SummaryComment: The SSH public key that can be used for remote login to the compute node.
Key.RemarksComment: <para>The public key should be compatible with Open SSH encoding and should be base 64 encoded. This property can be specified only for Linux nodes. The Batch service will return an error if this property is set for pools created with <see cref="Microsoft.Azure.Batch.CloudServiceConfiguration"/> or <see cref="Microsoft.Azure.Batch.VirtualMachineConfiguration"/> with Windows compute nodes.</para>

Types.Name: DeleteCertificateError
Types.Comment: An error encountered by the Batch service when deleting a certificate.

Key.Name: Code
Key.SummaryComment: A code for the certificate deletion error. See <see cref="Common.BatchErrorCodeStrings"/> for possible values.

Key.Name: Message
Key.SummaryComment: A message describing the certificagte deletion error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

Key.Name: Values
Key.SummaryComment: A list of additional error details related to the certificate deletion error.

Types.Name: EnvironmentSetting
Types.Comment: An environment variable to be set on a task process, such as a job task, start task, job manager task, or job preparation or release task.

Key.Name: Name
Key.SummaryComment: The name of the environment variable.

Key.Name: Value
Key.SummaryComment: The value of the environment variable.

Types.Name: ExitConditions
Types.Comment: How the Batch service should respond when a task completes.

Key.Name: ExitCodes
Key.SummaryComment: A list of task exit codes and how the Batch service should respond to them.

Key.Name: ExitCodeRanges
Key.SummaryComment: A list of task exit code ranges and how the Batch service should respond to them.

Key.Name: SchedulingError
Key.SummaryComment: How the Batch service should respond if the task fails with a scheduling error.

Key.Name: Default
Key.SummaryComment: How the Batch service should respond if the task fails with an exit condition not covered by any of the other properties.
Key.RemarksComment: This value is used if the task exits with any nonzero exit code not listed in the <see cref="ExitCodes"/> or <see cref="ExitCodeRanges"/> collection, or with a scheduling error if the <see cref="SchedulingError"/> property is not present.

Types.Name: ExitCodeMapping
Types.Comment: A process exit code and how the Batch service should respond if a task exits with that exit code.

Key.Name: Code
Key.SummaryComment: The process exit code.

Key.Name: ExitOptions
Key.SummaryComment: How the Batch service should respond if the task exits with this exit code.

Types.Name: ExitCodeRangeMapping
Types.Comment: A range of exit codes and how the Batch service should respond if a task exits with an exit code within that range.

Key.Name: Start
Key.SummaryComment: The first exit code in the range.
Key.RemarksComment: Ranges are inclusive. For example, if an <see cref="ExitCodeRangeMapping" /> specifies Start 8 and End 10, then it matches exit codes 8, 9 and 10.

Key.Name: End
Key.SummaryComment: The last exit code in the range.
Key.RemarksComment: Ranges are inclusive. For example, if an <see cref="ExitCodeRangeMapping" /> specifies Start 8 and End 10, then it matches exit codes 8, 9 and 10.

Key.Name: ExitOptions
Key.SummaryComment: An <see cref="ExitOptions" /> specifying how the Batch service should respond if the task exits with an exit code in the range <see cref="Start"/> to <see cref="End"/> inclusive.

Types.Name: ExitOptions
Types.Comment: How the Batch service should respond to a particular exit condition.

Key.Name: JobAction
Key.SummaryComment: An action to take on the job containing the task, if the task completes with the given exit condition and the job's <see cref="CloudJob.OnTaskFailure"/> property is <see cref="Common.OnTaskFailure.PerformExitOptionsJobAction"/>.

Types.Name: ErrorMessage
Types.Comment: An error message received in an Azure Batch error response.

Key.Name: Language
Key.SummaryComment: The language code of the error message.

Key.Name: Value
Key.SummaryComment: The text of the message.

Types.Name: FileProperties
Types.Comment: The properties of a file on a compute node.

Key.Name: CreationTime
Key.SummaryComment: The file creation time.

Key.Name: FileMode
Key.SummaryComment: The permission attribute for the file.
Key.RemarksComment: This property will be returned only for Linux nodes.

Key.Name: LastModified
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the file was last modified.

Key.Name: ContentLength
Key.SummaryComment: The length of the file.

Key.Name: ContentType
Key.SummaryComment: The content type of the file.

Types.Name: ImageReference
Types.Comment: A reference to an Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace image. To retrieve a list of images supported by the Batch service, see <see cref="PoolOperations.ListNodeAgentSkus"/> and <see cref="NodeAgentSku.VerifiedImageReferences"/>.

Key.Name: Offer
Key.SummaryComment: The offer type of the Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace image.
Key.RemarksComment: For example, UbuntuServer or WindowsServer.

Key.Name: Publisher
Key.SummaryComment: The publisher of the Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace image.
Key.RemarksComment: For example, Canonical or MicrosoftWindowsServer.

Key.Name: Sku
Key.SummaryComment: The SKU of the Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace image.
Key.RemarksComment: For example, 14.04.0-LTS or 2012-R2-Datacenter.

Key.Name: Version
Key.SummaryComment: The version of the Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace image.
Key.RemarksComment: If this property is not specified, it defaults to 'latest', which is the latest version of the image.

Types.Name: JobConstraints
Types.Comment: Specifies the execution constraints for a job.

Key.Name: MaxWallClockTime
Key.SummaryComment: The maximum elapsed time that the job may run, measured from the time the job is created.

Key.Name: MaxTaskRetryCount
Key.SummaryComment: The maximum number of times each task may be retried.

Types.Name: JobExecutionInformation
Types.Comment: Information about the execution of an Azure Batch job.

Key.Name: StartTime
Key.SummaryComment: The creation time of the job.

Key.Name: EndTime
Key.SummaryComment: The completion time of this job.

Key.Name: PoolId
Key.SummaryComment: The pool Id of this job.

Key.Name: SchedulingError
Key.SummaryComment: The error encountered by the Batch service in scheduling the job.

Key.Name: TerminateReason
Key.SummaryComment: The reason for job moving to completed state.

Types.Name: JobManagerTask
Types.Comment: Represents an Azure Batch JobManager task.

Key.Name: Id
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the task.

Key.Name: CommandLine
Key.SummaryComment: The command line of the task.
Key.RemarksComment: The command line does not run under a shell, and therefore cannot take advantage of shell features such as environment variable expansion. If you want to take advantage of such features, you should invoke the shell in the command line, for example using "cmd /c MyCommand" in Windows or "/bin/sh -c MyCommand" in Linux.

Key.Name: DisplayName
Key.SummaryComment: The display name of the JobManager task.

Key.Name: EnvironmentSettings
Key.SummaryComment: A set of environment settings for the JobManager task.

Key.Name: KillJobOnCompletion
Key.SummaryComment: A value that indicates whether to terminate all tasks in the job and complete the job when the job manager task completes.

Key.Name: ResourceFiles
Key.SummaryComment: A list of files that the Batch service will download to the compute node before running the command line.

Key.Name: RunElevated
Key.SummaryComment: Whether to run the task in elevated mode.

Key.Name: RunExclusive
Key.SummaryComment: whether the Job Manager task requires exclusive use of the compute node where it runs.

Key.Name: Constraints
Key.SummaryComment: The execution constraints for this JobManager task.

Key.Name: ApplicationPackageReferences
Key.SummaryComment: A list of application packages that the Batch service will deploy to the compute node before running the command line.

Types.Name: JobPreparationAndReleaseTaskExecutionInformation
Types.Comment: The status of the Job Preparation task and Job Release task on a compute node.

Key.Name: ComputeNodeId
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the compute node.

Key.Name: ComputeNodeUrl
Key.SummaryComment: The URL of the compute node.

Key.Name: JobPreparationTaskExecutionInformation
Key.SummaryComment: Details of the <see cref="CloudJob.JobPreparationTask">Job Preparation task</see> on this compute node.

Key.Name: JobReleaseTaskExecutionInformation
Key.SummaryComment: Details of the <see cref="CloudJob.JobReleaseTask">Job Release task</see> on this compute node.

Key.Name: PoolId
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the pool containing the compute node.

Types.Name: JobPreparationTask
Types.Comment: A Job Preparation task to run before any tasks of the job on any given compute node.

Key.Name: Id
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the task.

Key.Name: CommandLine
Key.SummaryComment: The command line of the task.
Key.RemarksComment: The command line does not run under a shell, and therefore cannot take advantage of shell features such as environment variable expansion. If you want to take advantage of such features, you should invoke the shell in the command line, for example using "cmd /c MyCommand" in Windows or "/bin/sh -c MyCommand" in Linux.

Key.Name: ResourceFiles
Key.SummaryComment: A list of files that the Batch service will download to the compute node before running the command line.

Key.Name: EnvironmentSettings
Key.SummaryComment: The collection of EnvironmentSetting instances.

Key.Name: RunElevated
Key.SummaryComment: Whether to run the task in elevated mode.

Key.Name: Constraints
Key.SummaryComment: The execution constraints provided by the user for this Job Preparation task.

Key.Name: WaitForSuccess
Key.SummaryComment: Whether the Batch service should wait for the successful completion of the Job Preparation task before scheduling any tasks on the compute node.
Key.RemarksComment: A Job Preparation task execution is considered successful if its ExitCode is 0. If this property is not specified, a default value of true is assigned by the Batch service.

Key.Name: RerunOnComputeNodeRebootAfterSuccess
Key.SummaryComment: Whether the Batch service should rerun the Job Preparation task after a compute node reboots.
Key.RemarksComment: The Job Preparation task is always rerun if a compute node is reimaged, or if the Job Preparation task did not complete (e.g. because the reboot occurred while the task was running). Therefore, you should always write a Job Preparation task to be idempotent and to behave correctly if run multiple times. If this property is not specified, a default value of true is assigned by the Batch service.

Types.Name: JobPreparationTaskExecutionInformation
Types.Comment: Details about the execution of a <see cref="CloudJob.JobPreparationTask">Job Preparation task</see> on a compute node.

Key.Name: EndTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the task completed.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is only returned if the task is in the <see cref="Common.JobPreparationTaskState.Completed"/> state.

Key.Name: ExitCode
Key.SummaryComment: The exit code of the program specified on the task command line.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is only returned if the task is in the <see cref="Common.JobPreparationTaskState.Completed"/> state. The exit code for a process reflects the specific convention implemented by the application developer for that process. If you use the exit code value to make decisions in your code, be sure that you know the exit code convention used by the application process. Note that the exit code may also be generated by the compute node operating system, such as when a process is forcibly terminated.

Key.Name: LastRetryTime
Key.SummaryComment: The most recent time at which this task's execution was retried by the Batch service.
Key.RemarksComment: This is only returned if the <see cref="RetryCount"/> is not 0.

Key.Name: RetryCount
Key.SummaryComment: The number of times the task has been retried by the Batch service. Every time the task exits with a non-zero exit code, it is deemed a task failure. The Batch service will retry the task up to the limit specified by the <see cref="JobPreparationTask.Constraints"/>.

Key.Name: SchedulingError
Key.SummaryComment: The TaskSchedulingError encountered by the service when starting the task.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is only returned if there was an error when scheduling the task, and it is now in the <see cref="Common.JobPreparationTaskState.Completed"/> state.

Key.Name: StartTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the task started running. Note that every time the task is restarted, this value is updated.

Key.Name: State
Key.SummaryComment: The current state of the task.
Key.RemarksComment: Running means the task is currently running. Completed means the task has completed. The Completed state includes the case where the task exits successfully with exit code 0 and the cases where the system fails to start the task process due to scheduling errors or the retry limit has reached after numerous task failures.

Key.Name: TaskRootDirectory
Key.SummaryComment: The root directory of the Job Preparation task on the compute node. You can use this path to retrieve files created by the task, such as log files.

Key.Name: TaskRootDirectoryUrl
Key.SummaryComment: The URL to the root directory of the Job Preparation task on the compute node.

Types.Name: JobReleaseTask
Types.Comment: A Job Release task to run on job completion on any compute node where the job has run.

Key.Name: Id
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the task.

Key.Name: CommandLine
Key.SummaryComment: The command line of the task.
Key.RemarksComment: The command line does not run under a shell, and therefore cannot take advantage of shell features such as environment variable expansion. If you want to take advantage of such features, you should invoke the shell in the command line, for example using "cmd /c MyCommand" in Windows or "/bin/sh -c MyCommand" in Linux.

Key.Name: ResourceFiles
Key.SummaryComment: A list of files that the Batch service will download to the compute node before running the command line.

Key.Name: EnvironmentSettings
Key.SummaryComment: The collection of EnvironmentSetting instances.

Key.Name: RunElevated
Key.SummaryComment: Whether to run the task in elevated mode.

Key.Name: MaxWallClockTime
Key.SummaryComment: The maximum duration of time for which a task is allowed to run from the time it is created.

Key.Name: RetentionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The duration of time for which files in the task's working directory are retained, from the time it completes execution. After this duration, the task's working directory is reclaimed.

Types.Name: JobReleaseTaskExecutionInformation
Types.Comment: Details about the execution of a <see cref="CloudJob.JobReleaseTask">Job Release task</see> on a compute node.

Key.Name: EndTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the task completed.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is only returned if the task is in the <see cref="Common.JobReleaseTaskState.Completed"/> state.

Key.Name: ExitCode
Key.SummaryComment: The exit code of the program specified on the task command line.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is only returned if the task is in the <see cref="Common.JobReleaseTaskState.Completed"/> state. The exit code for a process reflects the specific convention implemented by the application developer for that process. If you use the exit code value to make decisions in your code, be sure that you know the exit code convention used by the application process. Note that the exit code may also be generated by the compute node operating system, such as when a process is forcibly terminated.

Key.Name: SchedulingError
Key.SummaryComment: The scheduling error encountered by the service when starting the task.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is only returned if there was an error when scheduling the task and it is now in the <see cref="Common.JobReleaseTaskState.Completed"/> state.

Key.Name: StartTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the task started running. Note that every time the task is restarted, this value is updated.

Key.Name: State
Key.SummaryComment: The current state of the task.
Key.RemarksComment: Running means the task is currently running. Completed means the task has completed. The Completed state includes the case where the task exits successfully with exit code 0 and the cases where the system fails to start the task process due to scheduling errors or the retry limit has reached after numerous task failures.

Key.Name: TaskRootDirectory
Key.SummaryComment: The root directory of the Job Release task on the compute node. You can use this path to retrieve files created by the task, such as log files.

Key.Name: TaskRootDirectoryUrl
Key.SummaryComment: The URL to the root directory of the Job Release task on the compute node.

Types.Name: JobScheduleExecutionInformation
Types.Comment: The execution information for a job schedule.

Key.Name: NextRunTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the next job will be scheduled under this job schedule. This property is only returned for active job schedules.

Key.Name: EndTime
Key.SummaryComment: The completion time of the job schedule. This property is only returned for completed job schedules.

Key.Name: RecentJob
Key.SummaryComment: The information about the most recent job under the job schedule. Note that this element is only returned if the job schedule contains at least one job under it.

Types.Name: JobSchedulingError
Types.Comment: An error encountered by the Batch service when scheduling a job.

Key.Name: Category
Key.SummaryComment: The category of the job scheduling error.

Key.Name: Code
Key.SummaryComment: A code for the job scheduling error. See <see cref="Common.JobSchedulingErrorCodes"/> for possible values.

Key.Name: Message
Key.SummaryComment: A message describing the job scheduling error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

Key.Name: Details
Key.SummaryComment: A list of additional error details related to the scheduling error.

Types.Name: JobSpecification
Types.Comment: The <see cref="CloudJobSchedule.JobSpecification"/> of a <see cref="CloudJobSchedule"/>.

Key.Name: CommonEnvironmentSettings
Key.SummaryComment: A list of common environment variable settings.
Key.RemarksComment: These environment variables are set for all tasks in jobs created under this <see cref="CloudJobSchedule"/> (including the Job Manager, Job Preparation and Job Release tasks).

Key.Name: Constraints
Key.SummaryComment: The execution constraints for jobs created via this <see cref="JobSpecification"/>.

Key.Name: DisplayName
Key.SummaryComment: A display name for all jobs created via this <see cref="JobSpecification"/>.

Key.Name: JobManagerTask
Key.SummaryComment: Details of a Job Manager task to be launched when a job is created via this <see cref="JobSpecification"/>.

Key.Name: JobPreparationTask
Key.SummaryComment: The Job Preparation task for jobs created via this <see cref="JobSpecification"/>.
Key.RemarksComment: The Batch service will run the Job Preparation task on a compute node before starting any tasks of that job on that compute node.

Key.Name: JobReleaseTask
Key.SummaryComment: The Job Release task for jobs created via this <see cref="JobSpecification"/>.
Key.RemarksComment: The Batch service runs the Job Release task when the job ends, on each compute node where any task of the job has run.

Key.Name: PoolInformation
Key.SummaryComment: The pool on which the Batch service runs the tasks of jobs created via this <see cref="JobSpecification"/>.

Key.Name: Metadata
Key.SummaryComment: A list of name-value pairs associated with jobs created via this <see cref="JobSpecification"/> as metadata.

Key.Name: Priority
Key.SummaryComment: The priority of jobs created via this <see cref="JobSpecification"/>.
Key.RemarksComment: Priority values can range from -1000 to 1000, with -1000 being the lowest priority and 1000 being the highest priority.

Key.Name: UsesTaskDependencies
Key.SummaryComment: Whether tasks in jobs created under this <see cref="CloudJobSchedule"/> can define dependencies on each other.
Key.RemarksComment: The default value is false.

Types.Name: JobScheduleStatistics
Types.Comment: Resource usage statistics for a <see cref="CloudJobSchedule"/>.

Key.Name: Url
Key.SummaryComment: The URL of the statistics.

Key.Name: StartTime
Key.SummaryComment: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

Key.Name: LastUpdateTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the statistics were last updated. All statistics are limited to the range between <see cref="StartTime"/> and this value.

Key.Name: UserCpuTime
Key.SummaryComment: The total user mode CPU time (per core) consumed by all tasks in the job schedule.

Key.Name: KernelCpuTime
Key.SummaryComment: The total kernel mode CPU time (per core) consumed by all tasks in the job schedule.

Key.Name: WallClockTime
Key.SummaryComment: The total wall clock time of all tasks in the job schedule. Note that if any task was retried multiple times, this includes the wall clock time of all the task retries.

Key.Name: ReadIOps
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of disk read operations made by all tasks in the job schedule.

Key.Name: WriteIOps
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of disk write operations made by all tasks in the job schedule.

Key.Name: ReadIOGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The total gibibytes of I/O read from disk by all tasks in the job schedule.

Key.Name: WriteIOGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The total gibibytes of I/O written to disk by all tasks in the job schedule.

Key.Name: SucceededTaskCount
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of tasks successfully completed in the job schedule.

Key.Name: FailedTaskCount
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of tasks in the job that failed during the given time range.

Key.Name: TaskRetryCount
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of retries that occurred on all tasks in the job schedule.

Key.Name: WaitTime
Key.SummaryComment: The total wait time of all tasks in jobs created under the schedule. The wait time for a task is defined as the elapsed time between the creation of the task and the start of task execution. (If the task is retried due to failures, the wait time is the time to the most recent task execution.)
Key.RemarksComment: This value is only reported in the account lifetime statistics.

Types.Name: JobStatistics
Types.Comment: Resource usage statistics for the job.

Key.Name: Url
Key.SummaryComment: The URL of the job statistics.

Key.Name: StartTime
Key.SummaryComment: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

Key.Name: LastUpdateTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the statistics were last updated. All statistics are limited to the range between <see cref="StartTime"/> and this value.

Key.Name: UserCpuTime
Key.SummaryComment: The total user mode CPU time (per core) consumed by all tasks in the job.

Key.Name: KernelCpuTime
Key.SummaryComment: The total kernel mode CPU time (per core) consumed by all tasks in the job.

Key.Name: WallClockTime
Key.SummaryComment: The total elapsed time.

Key.Name: ReadIOps
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of disk read operations made by all tasks in the job.

Key.Name: WriteIOps
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of disk write operations made by all tasks in the job.

Key.Name: ReadIOGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The total gibibytes of I/O read from disk by all tasks in the job.

Key.Name: WriteIOGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The total gibibytes of I/O written to disk by all tasks in the job.

Key.Name: SucceededTaskCount
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of tasks successfully completed in the job during the given time range.

Key.Name: FailedTaskCount
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of task failures in the job.

Key.Name: TaskRetryCount
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of task retries in the job.

Key.Name: WaitTime
Key.SummaryComment: The total wait time of all tasks in the job. The wait time for a task is defined as the elapsed time between the creation of the task and the start of task execution. (If the task is retried due to failures, the wait time is the time to the most recent task execution.)
Key.RemarksComment: This value is only reported in the account lifetime statistics.

Types.Name: MetadataItem
Types.Comment: A name-value pair associated with a Batch service resource. The Batch service does not assign any meaning to this metadata; it is solely for the use of user code.

Key.Name: Name
Key.SummaryComment: The name of the <see cref="MetadataItem"/>.

Key.Name: Value
Key.SummaryComment: The value of the <see cref="MetadataItem"/>.

Types.Name: MultiInstanceSettings
Types.Comment: Settings which specify how to run a multi-instance task. Multi-instance tasks are commonly used to support MPI tasks. For more information see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/batch-mpi/.

Key.Name: CommonResourceFiles
Key.SummaryComment: A list of files that the Batch service will download before running the coordination command line.
Key.RemarksComment: The difference between common resource files and task resource files is that common resource files are downloaded for all subtasks including the primary, whereas task resource files are downloaded only for the primary.

Key.Name: CoordinationCommandLine
Key.SummaryComment: The command to run on the compute node instances for coordinating among the subtasks.

Key.Name: NumberOfInstances
Key.SummaryComment: The number of compute nodes required by the multi-instance task.

Types.Name: NameValuePair
Types.Comment: Represents a name-value pair.

Key.Name: Name
Key.SummaryComment: The name in the name-value pair.

Key.Name: Value
Key.SummaryComment: The value in the name-value pair.

Types.Name: NetworkConfiguration
Types.Comment: The network configuration for a pool.

Key.Name: SubnetId
Key.SummaryComment: The ARM resource identifier of the virtual network subnet which the compute nodes of the pool will join.
Key.RemarksComment: The virtual network must be in the same region and subscription as the Azure Batch account, and the specified subnet should have enough spare IP addresses to accommodate the number of nodes in the pool. This property can only be specified for pools created with a <see cref="CloudPool.CloudServiceConfiguration"/>.

Types.Name: NodeAgentSku
Types.Comment: A node agent SKU supported by the Batch service. The Batch node agent is a program that runs on each node in the pool, and provides the command-and-control interface between the node and the Batch service. There are different implementations of the node agent, known as SKUs, for different operating systems.

Key.Name: Id
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the node agent SKU.

Key.Name: VerifiedImageReferences
Key.SummaryComment: The list of images verified to be compatible with this node agent SKU. This collection is not exhaustive (the node agent may be compatible with other images).

Key.Name: OSType
Key.SummaryComment: The type of operating system compatible with the node agent SKU.

Types.Name: PoolInformation
Types.Comment: Specifies how a job should be assigned to a pool.

Key.Name: AutoPoolSpecification
Key.SummaryComment: The properties for the auto pool that will be created.
Key.RemarksComment: If this property is set, then <see cref="PoolId"/> must be left unset.

Key.Name: PoolId
Key.SummaryComment: The name of an existing pool that can be used for running tasks.
Key.RemarksComment: If this property is set, then <see cref="AutoPoolSpecification"/> must be left unset.

Types.Name: PoolSpecification
Types.Comment: The specification for a pool.

Key.Name: AutoScaleEnabled
Key.SummaryComment: Whether the pool size should automatically adjust over time.
Key.RemarksComment: <para>If false, the <see cref="TargetDedicated"/> property is required.</para> <para>If true, the <see cref="AutoScaleFormula"/> property is required. The pool automatically resizes according to the formula.</para> <para>The default value is false.</para>

Key.Name: ApplicationPackageReferences
Key.SummaryComment: A list of application package references to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

Key.Name: AutoScaleEvaluationInterval
Key.SummaryComment: A time interval at which to automatically adjust the pool size according to the <see cref="AutoScaleFormula"/>.
Key.RemarksComment: The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum allowed value is 5 minutes.

Key.Name: AutoScaleFormula
Key.SummaryComment: A formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: <para>For how to write autoscale formulas, see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/batch-automatic-scaling/. This property is required if <see cref="AutoScaleEnabled"/> is set to true. It must be null if AutoScaleEnabled is false.</para><para>The formula is checked for validity before the pool is created. If the formula is not valid, an exception is thrown when you try to commit the <see cref="PoolSpecification"/>.</para>

Key.Name: CloudServiceConfiguration
Key.SummaryComment: The <see cref="CloudServiceConfiguration"/> for the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is mutually exclusive with <see cref="VirtualMachineConfiguration"/>.

Key.Name: CertificateReferences
Key.SummaryComment: A list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

Key.Name: DisplayName
Key.SummaryComment: The display name for the pool.

Key.Name: InterComputeNodeCommunicationEnabled
Key.SummaryComment: Whether the pool permits direct communication between its compute nodes.
Key.RemarksComment: Enabling inter-node communication limits the maximum size of the pool due to deployment restrictions on the nodes of the pool. This may result in the pool not reaching its desired size.

Key.Name: NetworkConfiguration
Key.SummaryComment: The network configuration of the pool.

Key.Name: MaxTasksPerComputeNode
Key.SummaryComment: The maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: The default value is 1. The maximum value of this setting depends on the size of the compute nodes in the pool (the <see cref="VirtualMachineSize"/> property).

Key.Name: Metadata
Key.SummaryComment: A list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.

Key.Name: ResizeTimeout
Key.SummaryComment: The timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: <para>This timeout applies only to manual scaling; it has no effect when <see cref="AutoScaleEnabled"/> is set to true.</para><para>The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum value is 5 minutes.</para>

Key.Name: TaskSchedulingPolicy
Key.SummaryComment: How tasks are distributed among compute nodes in the pool.

Key.Name: StartTask
Key.SummaryComment: A task to run on each compute node as it joins the pool. The task runs when the node is added to the pool or when the node is restarted.

Key.Name: TargetDedicated
Key.SummaryComment: The desired number of compute nodes in the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: This setting cannot be specified if <see cref="AutoScaleEnabled"/> is set to true. It is required if AutoScaleEnabled is set to false.

Key.Name: VirtualMachineConfiguration
Key.SummaryComment: The <see cref="VirtualMachineConfiguration"/> of the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is mutually exclusive with <see cref="CloudServiceConfiguration"/>.

Key.Name: VirtualMachineSize
Key.SummaryComment: The size of the virtual machines in the pool.  All virtual machines in a pool are the same size.
Key.RemarksComment: <para>For information about available sizes of virtual machines for Cloud Services pools (pools created with a <see cref="CloudServiceConfiguration"/>), see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/cloud-services-sizes-specs/. Batch supports all Cloud Services VM sizes except ExtraSmall.</para><para>For information about available VM sizes for pools using images from the Virtual Machines Marketplace (pools created with a <see cref="VirtualMachineConfiguration"/>) see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-linux-sizes/ or https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-windows-sizes/. Batch supports all Azure VM sizes except STANDARD_A0 and those with premium storage (for example STANDARD_GS, STANDARD_DS, and STANDARD_DSV2 series).</para>

Types.Name: PoolStatistics
Types.Comment: Contains utilization and resource usage statistics for the lifetime of a pool.

Key.Name: Url
Key.SummaryComment: The URL for the statistics.

Key.Name: StartTime
Key.SummaryComment: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

Key.Name: LastUpdateTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the statistics were last updated. All statistics are limited to the range between <see cref="StartTime"/> and this value.

Key.Name: UsageStatistics
Key.SummaryComment: Statistics related to pool usage, such as the amount of core-time used.

Key.Name: ResourceStatistics
Key.SummaryComment: Statistics related to resource consumption by compute nodes in the pool, such as average CPU utilization.

Types.Name: PoolUsageMetrics
Types.Comment: The usage metrics for a single pool in a certain time range.

Key.Name: DataEgressGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The cross data center network egress from the pool during this interval, in gibibytes.

Key.Name: DataIngressGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The cross data center network ingress to the pool during this interval, in gibibytes.

Key.Name: EndTime
Key.SummaryComment: The end time of the aggregation interval for this entry.

Key.Name: PoolId
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the pool whose metrics are aggregated in this entry.

Key.Name: StartTime
Key.SummaryComment: The start time of the aggregation interval covered by this entry.

Key.Name: TotalCoreHours
Key.SummaryComment: The total core hours used in the pool during this aggregation interval.

Key.Name: VirtualMachineSize
Key.SummaryComment: The size of virtual machine in the pool. All virtual machines in a pool are the same size. Azure Batch supports all Azure virtual machine sizes except ExtraSmall.

Types.Name: RecentJob
Types.Comment: Information about the most recent job under a job schedule.

Key.Name: Url
Key.SummaryComment: The URL of the job.

Key.Name: Id
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the job.

Types.Name: RemoteLoginSettings
Types.Comment: Gets the settings required for remote login to a compute node.

Key.Name: IPAddress
Key.SummaryComment: The IP address used for remote login to the compute node.

Key.Name: Port
Key.SummaryComment: The port used for remote login to the compute node.

Types.Name: ResizeError
Types.Comment: An error that occurred when resizing a pool.

Key.Name: Code
Key.SummaryComment: A code for the pool resize error. See <see cref="Common.PoolResizeErrorCodes"/> for possible values.

Key.Name: Message
Key.SummaryComment: A message describing the pool resize error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

Key.Name: Values
Key.SummaryComment: A list of additional error details related to the pool resize error.

Types.Name: ResourceFile
Types.Comment: A file to be downloaded to a compute node from Azure Blob Storage, such as task executables and task input data files.

Key.Name: BlobSource
Key.SummaryComment: The URL of the file within Azure Blob Storage.
Key.RemarksComment: This URL should include a shared access signature if the blob is not publicly readable.

Key.Name: FileMode
Key.SummaryComment: The file permission mode attribute in octal format.
Key.RemarksComment: <para>This property is applicable only if the resource file is downloaded to a Linux node. This property will be ignored if it is specified for a <see cref="ResourceFile"/> which will be downloaded to a Windows node. If this property is not specified for a Linux node, then the default value is 0770.</para>

Key.Name: FilePath
Key.SummaryComment: The location to which to download the file, relative to the task's working directory.

Types.Name: ResourceStatistics
Types.Comment: The resource statistics data for the pool.

Key.Name: StartTime
Key.SummaryComment: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

Key.Name: LastUpdateTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the statistics were last updated. All statistics are limited to the range between <see cref="StartTime"/> and this value.

Key.Name: AverageCpuPercentage
Key.SummaryComment: The average CPU usage across all compute nodes in the pool (percentage per compute node).

Key.Name: AverageMemoryGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The average memory usage in gibibytes across all compute nodes in the pool.

Key.Name: PeakMemoryGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The peak memory usage in gibibytes across all compute nodes in the pool.

Key.Name: AverageDiskGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The average used disk space in gibibytes across all compute nodes in the pool.

Key.Name: PeakDiskGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The peak used disk space in gibibytes across all compute nodes in the pool.

Key.Name: DiskReadIOps
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of disk read operations across all compute nodes in the pool.

Key.Name: DiskWriteIOps
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of disk write operations across all compute nodes in the pool.

Key.Name: DiskReadGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The total amount of data in gibibytes of disk reads across all compute nodes in the pool.

Key.Name: DiskWriteGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The total amount of data in gibibytes of disk writes across all compute nodes in the pool.

Key.Name: NetworkReadGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The total amount of data in gibibytes of network reads across all compute nodes in the pool.

Key.Name: NetworkWriteGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The total amount of data in gibibytes of network writes across all compute nodes in the pool.

Types.Name: Schedule
Types.Comment: A schedule.

Key.Name: DoNotRunAfter
Key.SummaryComment: The wall clock time after which no job will be scheduled under this job schedule.

Key.Name: DoNotRunUntil
Key.SummaryComment: The earliest wall clock time at which to schedule the first job under this job schedule

Key.Name: RecurrenceInterval
Key.SummaryComment: The time interval between the start times of two successive jobs under the job schedule.

Key.Name: StartWindow
Key.SummaryComment: The window of time within which a job must be started from the time the job schedule is ready to be scheduled.

Types.Name: StartTask
Types.Comment: A task which is run when a compute node joins a pool in the Azure Batch service, or when the compute node is rebooted or reimaged.

Key.Name: CommandLine
Key.SummaryComment: The command line of the task.
Key.RemarksComment: The command line does not run under a shell, and therefore cannot take advantage of shell features such as environment variable expansion. If you want to take advantage of such features, you should invoke the shell in the command line, for example using "cmd /c MyCommand" in Windows or "/bin/sh -c MyCommand" in Linux.

Key.Name: EnvironmentSettings
Key.SummaryComment: A set of environment settings for the start task.

Key.Name: MaxTaskRetryCount
Key.SummaryComment: The maximum number of retries for the task.

Key.Name: ResourceFiles
Key.SummaryComment: A list of files that the Batch service will download to the compute node before running the command line.

Key.Name: RunElevated
Key.SummaryComment: Whether to run the task in elevated mode.

Key.Name: WaitForSuccess
Key.SummaryComment: A value indicating whether the Batch service should wait for the start task to complete before scheduling any tasks on the compute node.
Key.RemarksComment: If this is not specified, the default is false.

Types.Name: StartTaskInformation
Types.Comment: Specifies the detailed runtime information of the start task, including current state, error details, exit code, start time, end time, etc.

Key.Name: State
Key.SummaryComment: The current running state of the start task.

Key.Name: StartTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the task started running.

Key.Name: EndTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the task completed.

Key.Name: ExitCode
Key.SummaryComment: The exit code of the program specified on the task command line.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is only returned if the task is in the <see cref="Common.StartTaskState.Completed"/> state. The exit code for a process reflects the specific convention implemented by the application developer for that process. If you use the exit code value to make decisions in your code, be sure that you know the exit code convention used by the application process. Note that the exit code may also be generated by the compute node operating system, such as when a process is forcibly terminated.

Key.Name: SchedulingError
Key.SummaryComment: The error encountered by the service when scheduling the task.

Key.Name: RetryCount
Key.SummaryComment: The number of times the start task has been retried by the Batch system.

Key.Name: LastRetryTime
Key.SummaryComment: The most recent time at which execution of the start task was retried by the Batch service.

Types.Name: SubtaskInformation
Types.Comment: Information about an Azure Batch subtask.

Key.Name: ComputeNodeInformation
Key.SummaryComment: The information about the compute node on which the subtask ran.

Key.Name: State
Key.SummaryComment: The current state of the subtask.

Key.Name: StateTransitionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the subtask entered its current state.

Key.Name: StartTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the subtask started running. If the subtask has been restarted or retried, this is the most recent time at which the subtask started running.

Key.Name: EndTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the subtask completed. This property is set only if the subtask is in the Completed state.

Key.Name: ExitCode
Key.SummaryComment: The exit code of the program specified on the subtask command line.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is only returned if the subtask is in the <see cref="Common.TaskState.Completed"/> state. The exit code for a process reflects the specific convention implemented by the application developer for that process. If you use the exit code value to make decisions in your code, be sure that you know the exit code convention used by the application process. Note that the exit code may also be generated by the compute node operating system, such as when a process is forcibly terminated.

Key.Name: SchedulingError
Key.SummaryComment: The details of any error encountered scheduling the subtask.

Key.Name: Id
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the subtask.

Key.Name: PreviousState
Key.SummaryComment: The previous state of the subtask. This property is not set if the subtask is in its initial active state.

Key.Name: PreviousStateTransitionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the subtask entered its previous state. This property is not set if the subtask is in its initial active state.

Types.Name: TaskConstraints
Types.Comment: Defines the constraints on a particular Azure Batch task.

Key.Name: MaxWallClockTime
Key.SummaryComment: The maximum elapsed time that the task may run, measured from the time the task starts.

Key.Name: RetentionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The minimum time to retain the working directory for the task on the compute node where it ran, from the time it completes execution. After this time, the Batch service may delete the working directory and all its contents.

Key.Name: MaxTaskRetryCount
Key.SummaryComment: The maximum number of retries for the task.

Types.Name: TaskDependencies
Types.Comment: Specifies the tasks that a <see cref="CloudTask"/> depends on. The task will not be scheduled until all depended-on tasks have completed successfully.

Key.Name: TaskIdRanges
Key.SummaryComment: The list of task ranges that must complete before this task can be scheduled.

Key.Name: TaskIds
Key.SummaryComment: The list of task ids that must complete before this task can be scheduled.

Types.Name: TaskExecutionInformation
Types.Comment: Task execution information.

Key.Name: StartTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the task started running.

Key.Name: EndTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the task completed.

Key.Name: ExitCode
Key.SummaryComment: The exit code of the program specified on the task command line.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is only returned if the task is in the <see cref="Common.TaskState.Completed"/> state. The exit code for a process reflects the specific convention implemented by the application developer for that process. If you use the exit code value to make decisions in your code, be sure that you know the exit code convention used by the application process. Note that the exit code may also be generated by the compute node operating system, such as when a process is forcibly terminated.

Key.Name: SchedulingError
Key.SummaryComment: The error encountered by the service in starting the task. This parameter is only returned if there was an error in scheduling the task and it is now in completed state.

Key.Name: RetryCount
Key.SummaryComment: The number of times the task has been retried by the Batch service. Every time the task exits with a non-zero code, it is deemed as an application failure. The Batch service will retry the task up to the specified MaxTaskRetryCount.

Key.Name: LastRetryTime
Key.SummaryComment: The most recent time at which this task's execution was retried by the Batch service.

Key.Name: RequeueCount
Key.SummaryComment: The number of times this task's execution was re-queued by the Batch service per user request.

Key.Name: LastRequeueTime
Key.SummaryComment: The most recent time at which this task's execution was re-queued by the Batch service per user request.

Types.Name: TaskIdRange
Types.Comment: A range of task ids that a <see cref="CloudTask"/> depends on. All tasks with ids in the range must complete successfully before the dependent task can be scheduled.

Key.Name: Start
Key.SummaryComment: The first task id in the range.
Key.RemarksComment: Ranges are inclusive. For example, if a task depends on a range with Start 8, then task "8" must complete before the task can be scheduled.

Key.Name: End
Key.SummaryComment: The last task id in the range.
Key.RemarksComment: Ranges are inclusive. For example, if a task depends on a range with End 12, then task "12" must complete before the task can be scheduled.

Types.Name: TaskInformation
Types.Comment: The compute node's task info class.

Key.Name: TaskUrl
Key.SummaryComment: The task URL.

Key.Name: JobId
Key.SummaryComment: The job id.

Key.Name: TaskId
Key.SummaryComment: The task id.

Key.Name: SubtaskId
Key.SummaryComment: The subtask id.

Key.Name: TaskState
Key.SummaryComment: The task state.

Key.Name: ExecutionInformation
Key.SummaryComment: The execution information for the task.

Types.Name: TaskSchedulingError
Types.Comment: Information about an error when scheduling a task.

Key.Name: Category
Key.SummaryComment: The category of the task scheduling error.

Key.Name: Code
Key.SummaryComment: A code for the task scheduling error. See <see cref="Common.TaskSchedulingErrorCodes"/> for possible values.

Key.Name: Message
Key.SummaryComment: A message describing the task scheduling error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

Key.Name: Details
Key.SummaryComment: A list of additional error details related to the scheduling error.

Types.Name: TaskSchedulingPolicy
Types.Comment: A scheduling policy for a compute node.

Key.Name: ComputeNodeFillType
Key.SummaryComment: The fill type of scheduling policy.

Types.Name: TaskStatistics
Types.Comment: Resource usage statistics for the task.

Key.Name: Url
Key.SummaryComment: The URL of the task statistics.

Key.Name: StartTime
Key.SummaryComment: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

Key.Name: LastUpdateTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the statistics were last updated. All statistics are limited to the range between <see cref="StartTime"/> and this value.

Key.Name: UserCpuTime
Key.SummaryComment: The total user mode CPU time (per core) consumed by the task.

Key.Name: KernelCpuTime
Key.SummaryComment: The total kernel mode CPU time (per core) consumed by the task.

Key.Name: WallClockTime
Key.SummaryComment: The wall clock time of the task execution.

Key.Name: ReadIOps
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of disk read operations made by the task.

Key.Name: WriteIOps
Key.SummaryComment: The total number of disk write operations made by the task.

Key.Name: ReadIOGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The total gibibytes of I/O read from disk by the task.

Key.Name: WriteIOGiB
Key.SummaryComment: The total gibibytes of I/O written to disk by the task.

Key.Name: WaitTime
Key.SummaryComment: The total wait time of the task. The wait time for a task is defined as the elapsed time between the creation of the task and the start of task execution. (If the task is retried due to failures, the wait time is the time to the most recent task execution.)

Types.Name: UsageStatistics
Types.Comment: Statistics related to pool usage data.

Key.Name: StartTime
Key.SummaryComment: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

Key.Name: LastUpdateTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the statistics were last updated. All statistics are limited to the range between <see cref="StartTime"/> and this value.

Key.Name: DedicatedCoreTime
Key.SummaryComment: The aggregated wall-clock time of the dedicated compute nodes being part of the pool.

Types.Name: VirtualMachineConfiguration
Types.Comment: The configuration for compute nodes in a pool based on the Azure Virtual Machines infrastructure.

Key.Name: ImageReference
Key.SummaryComment: A reference to the Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace image to use.

Key.Name: NodeAgentSkuId
Key.SummaryComment: The SKU of Batch Node Agent to be provisioned on the compute node.
Key.RemarksComment: The Batch node agent is a program that runs on each node in the pool, and provides the command-and-control interface between the node and the Batch service. There are different implementations of the node agent, known as SKUs, for different operating systems.

Key.Name: WindowsConfiguration
Key.SummaryComment: Windows operating system settings on the virtual machine. This property must not be specified if the ImageReference property specifies a Linux OS image.

Types.Name: WindowsConfiguration
Types.Comment: Windows operating system settings to apply to the virtual machine.

Key.Name: EnableAutomaticUpdates
Key.SummaryComment: Whether automatic updates are enabled on the virtual machine. If unspecified, the default value is true.
